property.caption: Data source type
property.description: - The method of retrieving the objects. A normal XPath uses the Entity and XPath constraint. - The Microflow uses a standalone microflow that returns the objects. - The Microflow with context object can be used if the calendar is placed inside a dataview. This will use the Dataview data source microflow which will send along the Dataview Context object.

property.caption: Event Entity
property.description: The entity.

property.caption: XPath Constraint
property.description: The XPath constraint on the objects.

property.caption: Data source microflow
property.description: Setting this microflow will override the XPath retrieve option, and solely use this microflow to fill the calendar.

property.caption: Dataview Entity
property.description: The entity of the dataview object.

property.caption: Dataview data source microflow
property.description: Setting this microflow will override the XPath retrieve option, and solely use this microflow to fill the calendar.

property.caption: Start pos attribute
property.description: The date on which the calendar should start.

property.caption: Editable
property.description: Sets the editability of events. Defaults to true.

property.caption: All day
property.description: Boolean attribute to define/save whether this is an all day event.

property.caption: Limit events
property.description: Boolean attribute to define whether the amount of events for one single day should be limited.

property.caption: On change
property.description: Microflow to trigger on change.

property.caption: On click
property.description: Microflow to trigger on click.

property.caption: New event
property.description: The new event microflow.

property.caption: New event reference
property.description: Optional: The reference to connect the event to the context object.

property.caption: Height
property.description: The height in px.

property.caption: Show weeknumbers
property.description: Whether or not to show weeknumbers in the calendar. If 'YES' a column with weeknumbers will be added.

property.caption: Weeknumber Title
property.description: Title used for the weeknumber column, defaults to "W".

property.caption: Show weekends
property.description: Whether weekend should be shown on the calendar

property.caption: First day of the week
property.description: An integer to specify the first day of the week, 0 = Sunday, 1 = Monday etc.

property.caption: Custom time format
property.description: Default: h:mm{ - h:mm}. For more information: http://arshaw.com/fullcalendar/docs/text/timeFormat/

property.caption: Custom date format
property.description: For more information: http://arshaw.com/fullcalendar/docs/text/columnFormat/

property.caption: Custom title format
property.description: For more information: http://arshaw.com/fullcalendar/docs/text/titleFormat/

property.caption: Month names format
property.description: Comma seperated list of the full names of the months, starting at Januari.

property.caption: Month short names format
property.description: Comma seperated list of the short names of the months, starting at Jan.

property.caption: Day names format
property.description: Comma seperated list of the full names of the days, starting at Sunday.

property.caption: Day short names format
property.description: Comma seperated list of the short names of the days, starting at Sun.

property.caption: Language
property.description: The language for the calendar.

property.caption: Start view
property.description: Which is the default view when the widget is loaded

property.caption: Agenda axis time format
property.description: The format of the vertical axis labels in agenda views. Default: h(:mm)a

property.caption: Slot duration
property.description: The time interval (in minutes) of day and week calendars. Format: "00:30:00"

property.caption: Today button caption
property.description: Caption on button which jumps to today. Default: Today

property.caption: All-day caption
property.description: The text titling the "all-day" slot at the top of the calendar. Default: all-day. This option only applies to Agendaweek en AgendaDay views.

property.caption: Business hours
property.description: Use business hours (highlighted in Calendar). This option only applies to Agendaweek en AgendaDay views. Defaults to false.

property.caption: Start time
property.description: The start time for the business hours of each week day. This option only applies to Agendaweek en AgendaDay views. Format: "08:00"

property.caption: End time
property.description: The end time for the business hours of each week day. This option only applies to Agendaweek en AgendaDay views. Format: "17:00"

property.caption: Available views
property.description: Default will use: Month, Agenda week, Agenda day.

property.caption: Custom time format
property.description: Please refer to http://fullcalendar.io/docs/text/timeFormat/

property.caption: Custom date format
property.description: Please refer to http://fullcalendar.io/docs/text/columnFormat/

property.caption: Custom title format
property.description: Please refer to http://fullcalendar.io/docs/text/titleFormat/

property.caption: Label
property.description: Caption used for the 'calendar view' button.

property.caption: Event limit
property.description: The maximum number of events to display on a single day. When there are too many events, a link that looks like "+2 more" is displayed.

property.caption: On view change
property.description: Microflow triggered when a new date-range is rendered, or when the view type switches.(http://fullcalendar.io/docs/display/viewRender/)

property.caption: Entity
property.description: The entity being passed to the on view change microflow. Reflecting the view change start and end date.

property.caption: Start date
property.description: The starting date of the view (fullcalendar's intervalStart of the view). E.g. first day of the month when rendering month view.

property.caption: End date
property.description: The ending date of the view (fullcalendar's intervalEnd of the view). E.g. last day of the month when rendering month view
